title: How to Download a File from Github

steps.title: Go to https://github.com/ in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://github.com/ in a web browser. You can use any web browser to download files.

steps.title: Navigate to the file you want to download.
steps.content: Navigate to the file you want to download. Use the search bar at the top of the page to find the file you want to download and the results will list repositories that match your search. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Releases (if it's available).
steps.content: Click Releases (if it's available). You'll see this option on the right side of the browser. [2] X Research source Once you click Releases , you can click to download the installer or the source code. If there is no Releases available, continue following these steps to download a file.

steps.title: Click Go to file.
steps.content: Click Go to file . You'll see this above the list of files within this repository next to a button to download all the files. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click to select a file that you want to download.
steps.content: Click to select a file that you want to download. It'll open within GitHub in your web browser.

steps.title: Click Raw.
steps.content: Click Raw . You'll see this next to Blame and a monitor icon above the space where the file displays. [4] X Research source The page will redirect to display the file contents without any GitHub headers, footers, or menus.

steps.title: Right-click the page and click Save as.
steps.content: Right-click the page and click Save as . Alternatively, you can press the keyboard shortcut Ctrl/CMD + S . Your file manager will open so you can select a name and location to save the file. If you want to download the entire repository instead, navigate to the root (click the first half of the link, which is usually before any / ), click the button with the download icon (it will usually say Code), and click Download ZIP . [5] X Research source
